DOC.brief_summary: This will be a randomized, controlled, parallel-group clinical trial. The aim of this study will be to evaluate the effectiveness of "Tell-Show-Do" Behavior Management Technique versus a Conventional technique (covering the patient's vision) during an inferior alveolar and lingual nerve block in preschool children referred for treatment at the School of Dentistry, University of Sao Paulo, Brazil. The sample will consist of 52 children from 3 years old to 5 years 11 months old who need dental pulp treatment and / or tooth extraction of primary molars. Preschool children with no history of allergies to Lidocaine anesthetic or systemic/neurological diseases and who did not take local anesthesia before the study will be include in this research.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Tell-Show-Do Behavior-Management Technique During Local Anesthesia in Preschool Children
DOC.detailed_description: Children will be randomly allocated to treatment groups (n = 26 for each group) according to the technique: (1) Tell-Show-Do and (2) Conventional. Anxiety and pain will be evaluated by the scale of Facial Image (EIF) and Wong-Baker Pain Scale, respectively. The cooperation of the patient will be evaluated by behavioral scale Frankl.
DOC.criteria: 1. Preschool children with severe dental caries who need dental pulp treatment and / or tooth extraction of inferior primary molars. 1. Preschool children with history of allergies to Lidocaine (local anesthetic) 2. Preschool children with systemic or neurological diseases 3. Preschool children who have received local dental anaesthesia before this study
